column1: Appendix table 1. Counts for figure 1: Number of RICO investigations concluded by U.S. attorneys and persons investigated, FY 2012–2022
Report title: Racketeer Influenced and Corrupt Organizations (RICO) Cases in Federal Courts, 2012–2022  NCJ 308952
Data source: Bureau of Justice Statistics, based on data from the Executive Office for U.S. Attorneys, National Legal Information Office Network System (LIONS) database, fiscal years 2012–2022
Authors: Suzanne M. Strong, PhD, and Mark Motivans, PhD, BJS Statisticians
Appendix table 1. Counts for figure 1: Number of RICO investigations concluded by U.S. attorneys and persons investigated, FY 2012–2022

Note: Includes persons in matters who were charged under Title 18 U.S.C. §§ 1961–1968. The lead charge is the primary basis for referring the matter to a U.S. attorney and is usually, but not always, the charge with the greatest possible sentence. RICO denotes Racketeer Influenced and Corrupt Organizations Act.
Source: Bureau of Justice Statistics, based on data from the Executive Office for U.S. Attorneys, National Legal Information Office Network (LIONS) database, fiscal years 2012–2022.
